metadata.title: CVE-2022-25636 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
net/netfilter/nf_dup_netdev.c in the Linux kernel 5.4 through 5.6.10 allowslocal users to gain privileges because of a heap out-of-bounds write. Thisis related to nf_tables_offload.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-104-generic - 5.4.0-104.118
linux-image-5.4.0-104-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-104.118
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-104-generic - 5.4.0-104.118
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-104-lowlatency - 5.4.0-104.118
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-35-generic - 5.13.0-35.40~20.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-104.118').
